job_description: Major responsibilities include developing and using measurement tools for on-going fuel cell projects at Ballard in the area of fuel cell performance characterization.Requires good knowledge of fluid mechanics, heat transfer and electrical processes and some experience with experimental work in this area is required. This Co-op position may also be required to support other projects with experimental work to determine several MEA (membrane electrode assembly) properties. Although analytical expertise such as mathematical modeling is not directly required, it will be considered an important asset.
job_requirements: Students from the following disciplines, preferably in third or forth year of study are appropriate for this opportunity: Chemical Engineering Materials Engineering Mechanical Engineering Integrated Engineering Electrical Engineering Engineering PhysicsKey skills include: Ability to work in the lab, be very “hands on” Data analysis using Excel and data presentation Strong oral and written communication ability Basic understanding of fuel cell operation is an assetBallard values diversity in the workplace and is committed to Employment Equity.  We encourage applications from all qualified candidates.Open To All Majors:Yes
